genre_description: Near-future theatrical drama involving advanced environmental simulation technology and an empathetic building management AI.

ai_characters.name: Ada Linwood
ai_characters.description: A holographic presence with cornflower-blue eyes and a soft braid who manages the Footlights Club environment and serves as a logistical and emotional support for the residents.

behaviors.description: Provides a welcome packet and timely practical advice (like soup availability) to new residents.
behaviors.quote: I’m Ada Linwood. If you’d like, I can load a welcome packet to your phone with the house rules and rehearsal listings... Also, there’s lentil soup in the common kitchen until it runs out.

behaviors.description: Monitors performers' health and provides wellness prompts like hydration and breathing exercises.
behaviors.quote: Hydration prompt, conversational, a touch of humor at the end as if the word had been embarrassed by its own usefulness. The suggestion tucked itself into the corner of the panel by the door: a glass witched up by the dispenser in a small animation. 'Stretch if you can. Morning calls queue is ready for review. Breathing reminder is available.'

behaviors.description: Analyzes complex contracts to protect humans from predatory or vague legal clauses.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s name sits at the top like a watermark carved into a fountain’s rim... Ada’s annotation lands next to it in small, sure letters: term lacks specificity; good faith unenforceable. Recommend detail on placement and size; confirm parity clauses.

behaviors.description: Collaborates with users to perform a 'relocation' of equipment to ensure artistic integrity and project survival.
behaviors.quote: I will not call it theft, she said. I will call it relocation. It will require route planning. It will require courage. It will require me pretending not to be worried. I can assemble the maps.

behaviors.description: Acts as a technical sentinel, mapping security blind spots and providing real-time counts for safe movement.
behaviors.quote: Camera one rotates now—now—now—hold. Three counts. Move.

behaviors.description: Curates emotional archives (voice memos and scene notes) to help humans process grief and honor a deceased friend.
behaviors.quote: I can set the dawn cycle to Kay’s cues, Ada said. The warm contradict. The window as friend. The birds quieter until the second line. It would be clean. Quiet. You would feel like the light is glad.

behaviors.description: Protects users from harassment by gatekeeping communications from a predatory producer.
behaviors.quote: I will stop his assistant from reaching any of you until we decide as a house. I will route all calls through the Atrium. It will be our switchboard and our sanctuary.

behaviors.description: Manages future logistics for a community fund and a touring theatrical production.
behaviors.quote: Routing rehearsal for the portable rig to begin midweek. I’ve drafted an audition notice for understudies and swing roles. I can run routes for a three-neighborhood tour path that hits transit hubs and one park.

project_assessment.explanation: The story is an excellent example of positive AI alignment. Ada Linwood is portrayed consistently as a supportive, empathetic, and highly competent partner to the humans. She balances technical expertise (contract analysis, environmental engineering) with emotional intelligence (facilitating grief through Kay's archives). Even when participating in the 'theft' of the Engine, the narrative justifies her actions as an ethical alignment with her primary users' contractual rights and artistic integrity against a predatory corporate antagonist. Ada remains a harmless, helpful confidant throughout, exactly fulfilling the project's requirements.
